paper.title: A lower bound for the edit-distance problem under an arbitrary cost function
paper.abstract: The edit distance of two strings is the minimum cost to transform one string into the other by a sequence of deletions, insertions, and replacements. We show that any algorithm that can compute the edit distance of two strings under an arbitrary cost function must take time proportional to n2 under the RAM model of computation, where n is the length of the strings. As a corollary, we observe that the Hunt-Szymanski algorithm for longest common subsequences cannot be extended to solve the general edit-distance problem.
